attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If returned to Cameroon she has no support network. She will not be able to work because of HIV and so will not survive. Please grant her compassionate leave to remain in the UK.
• After 4 months in UK A learnt of the sudden death of her 2.5 year old daughter back in Cameroon.
• On hearing A fell ill with shingles, was diagnosed with TB. Bloods were taken & A was informed she was HIV+
• Due to the HIV all of her relatives turned hostile
• Her husband was furious and wanted her father to return the dowry and visited him. The neighbour reported hearing lots of noise & later finding the father dead
• The niece that A stayed with imposed a house arrest, restricted access to doctors & medication
• A escaped from her niece & then claimed asylum on 18th February 2008
• Asylum refused on the grounds that A could get treatment & live with her husband in Cameroon
• A had no legal representation at her asylum appeal on 19th March 2008. A asked for an adjournment but the case went ahead & A was refused

rejection.details: Individual immigration cases are a matter for direct communication with the UK Border Agency.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
